001package com.deploygate.sdk;
002
003import android.app.Application;
004import android.content.BroadcastReceiver;
005import android.content.ComponentName;
006import android.content.Context;
007import android.content.Intent;
008import android.content.IntentFilter;
009import android.content.ServiceConnection;
010import android.os.Build;
011import android.os.Bundle;
012import android.os.Handler;
013import android.os.IBinder;
014import android.os.RemoteException;
015import android.text.TextUtils;
016import android.util.Log;
017
018import com.deploygate.sdk.internal.Logger;
019import com.deploygate.sdk.internal.VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks;
020import com.deploygate.service.DeployGateEvent;
021import com.deploygate.service.IDeployGateSdkService;
022import com.deploygate.service.IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback;
023
024import java.util.HashMap;
025import java.util.HashSet;
026import java.util.Iterator;
027import java.util.LinkedList;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
030import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
031
032/**
033 * This is DeployGate SDK library. Import this library to the application
034 * package and call {@link #install(Application)} on the onCreate() of
035 * application class to enable crash reporting and application launch
036 * notification.
037 * <p>
038 * In order to get working Remote LogCat feature, you also have to add
039 * <code>&lt;uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_LOGS" /&gt;</code>
040 * in AndroidManifest.xml of your application.
041 * </p>
042 *
043 * @author tnj
044 */
045public class DeployGate {
046    private static final String TAG = "DeployGate";
047
048    private static final String ACTION_DEPLOYGATE_STARTED = "com.deploygate.action.ServiceStarted";
049    private static final String DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE = "com.deploygate";
050    private static final Object sPendingEventLock = new Object();
051
052    private static DeployGate sInstance;
053
054    private final Context mApplicationContext;
055    private final DeployGateClient mDeployGateClient;
056    private final HostApp mHostApp;
057    private final Handler mHandler;
058    private final ILogcatInstructionSerializer mLogcatInstructionSerializer;
059    private final CustomLogInstructionSerializer mCustomLogInstructionSerializer;
060    private final HashSet<DeployGateCallback> mCallbacks;
061    private final HashMap<String, Bundle> mPendingEvents;
062    private final String mExpectedAuthor;
063    private String mAuthor;
064
065    private CountDownLatch mInitializedLatch;
066    private boolean mIsDeployGateAvailable;
067
068    private boolean mAppIsManaged;
069    private boolean mAppIsAuthorized;
070    private boolean mAppIsStopRequested;
071    private String mLoginUsername;
072    private String mDistributionUserName;
073    private int mCurrentRevision;
074    private String mDistributionId;
075    private String mDistributionTitle;
076
077    private boolean mAppUpdateAvailable;
078    private int mAppUpdateRevision;
079    private String mAppUpdateVersionName;
080    private int mAppUpdateVersionCode;
081    private String mAppUpdateMessage;
082
083    private IDeployGateSdkService mRemoteService;
084
085    private final IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback mRemoteCallback = new IDeployGateSdkServiceCallback.Stub() {
086
087        public void onEvent(
088                String action,
089                Bundle extras
090        ) throws RemoteException {
091            if (TextUtils.isEmpty(action)) {
092                return;
093            }
094
095            // ensure non-null
096            extras = extras != null ? extras : new Bundle();
097
098            if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_INIT.equals(action)) {
099                onInitialized(extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_MANAGED, false), extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_AUTHORIZED, false), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGIN_USERNAME), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_DISTRIBUTION_USER_NAME), extras.getBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_STOP_REQUESTED, false), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_AUTHOR), extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_REVISION, 0), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_DISTRIBUTION_ID), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CURRENT_DISTRIBUTION_TITLE));
100            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_UPDATE_AVAILABLE.equals(action)) {
101                onUpdateArrived(extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SERIAL), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VERSION_NAME), extras.getInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VERSION_CODE), extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SERIAL_MESSAGE));
102            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_ONESHOT_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
103                String captureId = null;
104
105                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.DEVICE_CAPTURE)) {
106                    // still nullable
107                    captureId = extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CAPTURE_ID);
108                }
109
110                onOneshotLogcat(captureId);
111            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_ENABLE_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
112                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.STREAMED_LOGCAT)) {
113                    String sessionKey = extras.getString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGCAT_STREAM_SESSION_KEY);
114
115                    if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sessionKey)) {
116                        Logger.w("%s is missing in the extra", DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_LOGCAT_STREAM_SESSION_KEY);
117                        return;
118                    }
119
120                    onEnableStreamedLogcat(sessionKey);
121                } else {
122                    Logger.w("streamed logcat is not supported");
123                }
124            } else if (DeployGateEvent.ACTION_DISABLE_LOGCAT.equals(action)) {
125                if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.STREAMED_LOGCAT)) {
126                    onDisableStreamedLogcat();
127                } else {
128                    Logger.w("streamed logcat is not supported");
129                }
130            } else {
131                Logger.w("%s is not supported by this sdk version", action);
132            }
133        }
134
135        private void onInitialized(
136                final boolean isManaged,
137                final boolean isAuthorized,
138                final String loginUsername,
139                final String distributionUserName,
140                final boolean isStopped,
141                final String author,
142                int currentRevision,
143                String distributionId,
144                String distributionTitle
145        ) throws RemoteException {
146            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service initialized");
147            mAppIsManaged = isManaged;
148            mAppIsAuthorized = isAuthorized;
149            mAppIsStopRequested = isStopped;
150            mLoginUsername = loginUsername;
151            mDistributionUserName = distributionUserName;
152            mAuthor = author;
153            mCurrentRevision = currentRevision;
154            mDistributionId = distributionId;
155            mDistributionTitle = distributionTitle;
156
157            mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
158                @Override
159                public void run() {
160                    for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
161                        callback.onInitialized(true);
162                        callback.onStatusChanged(isManaged, isAuthorized, loginUsername, isStopped);
163                    }
164                }
165            });
166
167            mIsDeployGateAvailable = true;
168
169            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.setDisabled(false);
170            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.connect(mRemoteService);
171            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.setEnabled(true);
172            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.connect(mRemoteService);
173
174            mInitializedLatch.countDown();
175
176            // to release a lock as soon as possible.
177            flushPendingEvents();
178        }
179
180        private void onUpdateArrived(
181                final int serial,
182                final String versionName,
183                final int versionCode,
184                final String message
185        ) throws RemoteException {
186            mAppUpdateAvailable = true;
187            mAppUpdateRevision = serial;
188            mAppUpdateVersionName = versionName;
189            mAppUpdateVersionCode = versionCode;
190            mAppUpdateMessage = message;
191
192            mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
193                @Override
194                public void run() {
195                    for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
196                        callback.onUpdateAvailable(serial, versionName, versionCode);
197                    }
198                }
199            });
200        }
201    };
202
203    @SuppressWarnings("FieldCanBeLocal")
204    private final VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks.OnVisibilityChangeListener mOnVisibilityChangeListener = new VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks.OnVisibilityChangeListener() {
205
206        @Override
207        public void onForeground(
208                long elapsedRealtime,
209                TimeUnit timeUnit
210        ) {
211            Bundle extras = new Bundle();
212            extras.putLong(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_ELAPSED_REAL_TIME_IN_NANOS, timeUnit.toNanos(elapsedRealtime));
213            extras.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_TYPE, DeployGateEvent.VisibilityType.FOREGROUND);
214            invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_VISIBILITY_EVENT, extras, true);
215        }
216
217        @Override
218        public void onBackground(
219                long elapsedRealtime,
220                TimeUnit timeUnit
221        ) {
222            Bundle extras = new Bundle();
223            extras.putLong(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_ELAPSED_REAL_TIME_IN_NANOS, timeUnit.toNanos(elapsedRealtime));
224            extras.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_VISIBILITY_EVENT_TYPE, DeployGateEvent.VisibilityType.BACKGROUND);
225            invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_VISIBILITY_EVENT, extras, true);
226        }
227    };
228
229    private void requestOneshotLogcat() {
230        onOneshotLogcat(null);
231    }
232
233    private void onOneshotLogcat(String captureId) {
234        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.requestOneshotLogcat(captureId);
235    }
236
237    private void onEnableStreamedLogcat(String streamSessionKey) {
238        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(streamSessionKey)) {
239            Logger.w("sdk-origin streamed logcat requests are forbidden");
240            return;
241        }
242
243        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.requestStreamedLogcat(streamSessionKey);
244    }
245
246    private void onDisableStreamedLogcat() {
247        mLogcatInstructionSerializer.stopStream();
248    }
249
250    void callbackDeployGateUnavailable() {
251        mHandler.post(new Runnable() {
252            @Override
253            public void run() {
254                for (DeployGateCallback callback : mCallbacks) {
255                    callback.onInitialized(false);
256                    callback.onStatusChanged(false, false, null, false);
257                }
258            }
259        });
260    }
261
262
263    /**
264     * Do not instantiate directly. Call {@link #install(Application)} on your
265     * {@link Application#onCreate()} instead.
266     */
267    private DeployGate(
268            Context applicationContext,
269            String author,
270            DeployGateCallback callback,
271            CustomLogConfiguration customLogConfiguration,
272            HostApp hostApp
273    ) {
274        mApplicationContext = applicationContext;
275        mDeployGateClient = new DeployGateClient(applicationContext, DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE);
276        mHostApp = hostApp;
277        mHandler = new Handler();
278        mLogcatInstructionSerializer = mHostApp.canUseLogcat ? new LogcatInstructionSerializer(mHostApp.packageName) : ILogcatInstructionSerializer.NULL_INSTANCE;
279        mCustomLogInstructionSerializer = new CustomLogInstructionSerializer(mHostApp.packageName, customLogConfiguration);
280        mCallbacks = new HashSet<>();
281        mPendingEvents = new HashMap<>();
282        mExpectedAuthor = author;
283
284        prepareBroadcastReceiver();
285
286        if (callback != null) {
287            mCallbacks.add(callback);
288        }
289
290        mInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
291        ((Application) applicationContext).registerActivityLifecycleCallbacks(new VisibilityLifecycleCallbacks(mOnVisibilityChangeListener));
292        initService(true);
293    }
294
295    private boolean initService(boolean isBoot) {
296        if (mDeployGateClient.isInstalled) {
297            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate installation detected. Initializing.");
298            bindToService(isBoot);
299            return true;
300        } else {
301            Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate is not available on this device.");
302            mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.setDisabled(true);
303            mLogcatInstructionSerializer.setEnabled(false);
304            mInitializedLatch.countDown();
305            mIsDeployGateAvailable = false;
306            callbackDeployGateUnavailable();
307            return false;
308        }
309    }
310
311    private void prepareBroadcastReceiver() {
312        IntentFilter filter = new IntentFilter(ACTION_DEPLOYGATE_STARTED);
313        BroadcastReceiver receiver = new BroadcastReceiver() {
314            @Override
315            public void onReceive(
316                    Context context,
317                    Intent intent
318            ) {
319                if (intent == null) {
320                    return;
321                }
322                if (mDeployGateClient.isInstalled) {
323                    bindToService(false);
324                }
325            }
326        };
327
328        if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.TIRAMISU) {
329            mApplicationContext.registerReceiver(receiver, filter, Context.RECEIVER_EXPORTED);
330        } else {
331            mApplicationContext.registerReceiver(receiver, filter);
332        }
333    }
334
335    private void bindToService(final boolean isBoot) {
336        Intent service = new Intent(IDeployGateSdkService.class.getName());
337        service.setPackage(DEPLOYGATE_PACKAGE);
338        mApplicationContext.bindService(service, new ServiceConnection() {
339            public void onServiceConnected(
340                    ComponentName name,
341                    IBinder service
342            ) {
343                Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service connected");
344                mRemoteService = IDeployGateSdkService.Stub.asInterface(service);
345                requestServiceInit(isBoot);
346            }
347
348            @Override
349            public void onServiceDisconnected(ComponentName name) {
350                Log.v(TAG, "DeployGate service disconneced");
351                mRemoteService = null;
352                mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.disconnect();
353                mLogcatInstructionSerializer.disconnect();
354            }
355        }, Context.BIND_AUTO_CREATE);
356    }
357
358    private void requestServiceInit(final boolean isBoot) {
359        Bundle args = new Bundle();
360        args.putBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_IS_BOOT, isBoot);
361        args.putBoolean(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_CAN_LOGCAT, mHostApp.canUseLogcat);
362        args.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXPECTED_AUTHOR, mExpectedAuthor);
363        args.putInt(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_SDK_VERSION, mHostApp.sdkVersion);
364        try {
365            mRemoteService.init(mRemoteCallback, mHostApp.packageName, args);
366        } catch (RemoteException e) {
367            Log.w(TAG, "DeployGate service failed to be initialized.");
368        }
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * Send an event to the client application
373     *
374     * @param action
375     *         to be sent
376     * @param extras
377     *         to be sent
378     * @param allowPending
379     *         Allow queueing events to send them after a service connection is established (since 4.6.0)
380     */
381    private void invokeAction(
382            String action,
383            Bundle extras,
384            boolean allowPending
385    ) {
386        extras = extras != null ? extras : new Bundle();
387
388        if (mRemoteService == null) {
389            if (allowPending) {
390                synchronized (sPendingEventLock) {
391                    mPendingEvents.put(action, extras);
392                }
393            }
394
395            return;
396        }
397        try {
398            mRemoteService.sendEvent(mHostApp.packageName, action, extras);
399        } catch (RemoteException e) {
400            Log.w(TAG, "failed to invoke " + action + " action: " + e.getMessage());
401        }
402    }
403
404    private void flushPendingEvents() {
405        // cannot re-enqueue events for now
406        synchronized (sPendingEventLock) {
407            Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Bundle>> iterator = mPendingEvents.entrySet().iterator();
408
409            while (iterator.hasNext()) {
410                Map.Entry<String, Bundle> entry = iterator.next();
411                invokeAction(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue(), false);
412                iterator.remove();
413            }
414        }
415    }
416
417    /**
418     * Clear the initiated DeployGate instance.
419     * <p>
420     * This method is only for testing so breaking changes would may happen.
421     */
422    static void clear() {
423        sInstance = null;
424    }
425
426    /**
427     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
428     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()} once.
429     * <p>
430     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
431     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
432     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
433     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
434     * instead.
435     * </p>
436     * <p>
437     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
438     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
439     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
440     * redistribution via DeployGate.
441     * </p>
442     *
443     * @param app
444     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
445     *
446     * @throws IllegalStateException
447     *         if this called twice
448     * @since r1
449     */
450    public static void install(Application app) {
451        install(app, (String) null);
452    }
453
454    /**
455     * Install DeployGate on your application instance. Call this method inside
456     * of your {@link Application#onCreate()} once.
457     * <p>
458     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
459     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
460     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
461     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
462     * instead.
463     * </p>
464     *
465     * @param app
466     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
467     * @param author
468     *         author username of this app.
469     *
470     * @throws IllegalStateException
471     *         if this called twice
472     * @since r2
473     */
474    public static void install(
475            Application app,
476            String author
477    ) {
478        install(app, author, null);
479    }
480
481    /**
482     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
483     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
484     * once.
485     * <p>
486     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
487     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
488     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
489     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
490     * instead.
491     * </p>
492     * <p>
493     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
494     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
495     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
496     * redistribution via DeployGate.
497     * </p>
498     *
499     * @param app
500     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
501     * @param callback
502     *         Callback interface to listen events.
503     *
504     * @throws IllegalStateException
505     *         if this called twice
506     * @since r1
507     */
508    public static void install(
509            Application app,
510            DeployGateCallback callback
511    ) {
512        install(app, null, callback);
513    }
514
515    /**
516     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
517     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
518     * once.
519     * <p>
520     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
521     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
522     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
523     * redistribution via DeployGate.
524     * </p>
525     *
526     * @param app
527     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
528     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
529     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
530     *         the release build, set this true.
531     *
532     * @throws IllegalStateException
533     *         if this called twice
534     * @since r4.2
535     */
536    public static void install(
537            Application app,
538            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
539    ) {
540        install(app, null, null, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild);
541    }
542
543    /**
544     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
545     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
546     * once.
547     * <p>
548     * On a release build, which has <code>android:isDebuggable</code> set false on
549     * AndroidManifest.xml, this function will do nothing. If you want to enable
550     * DeployGate on a release build, consider using
551     * {@link #install(Application, String, DeployGateCallback, boolean)}
552     * instead.
553     * </p>
554     *
555     * @param app
556     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
557     * @param author
558     *         author username of this app.
559     * @param callback
560     *         Callback interface to listen events.
561     *
562     * @throws IllegalStateException
563     *         if this called twice
564     * @since r2
565     */
566    public static void install(
567            Application app,
568            String author,
569            DeployGateCallback callback
570    ) {
571        install(app, author, callback, false);
572    }
573
574    /**
575     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
576     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
577     * once.
578     * <p>
579     * <b>Note:</b> To make {@link #isAuthorized()} more effective, you should
580     * call {@link #install(Application, String)} instead and specify authorId
581     * explicitly to ensure the authority of this app to prevent casual
582     * redistribution via DeployGate.
583     * </p>
584     *
585     * @param app
586     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
587     * @param callback
588     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
589     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
590     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
591     *         the release build, set this true.
592     *
593     * @throws IllegalStateException
594     *         if this called twice
595     * @since r1
596     */
597    public static void install(
598            Application app,
599            DeployGateCallback callback,
600            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
601    ) {
602        install(app, null, callback, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild);
603    }
604
605    /**
606     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
607     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
608     * once.
609     *
610     * @param app
611     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
612     * @param author
613     *         author username of this app. Can be null.
614     * @param callback
615     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
616     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
617     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
618     *         the release build, set this true.
619     *
620     * @since r2
621     */
622    public static void install(
623            Application app,
624            String author,
625            DeployGateCallback callback,
626            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
627    ) {
628        install(app, author, callback, forceApplyOnReleaseBuild, new CustomLogConfiguration.Builder().build());
629    }
630
631    /**
632     * Install DeployGate on your application instance and register a callback
633     * listener. Call this method inside of your {@link Application#onCreate()}
634     * once.
635     *
636     * @param app
637     *         Application instance, typically just pass <em>this</em>.
638     * @param author
639     *         author username of this app. Can be null.
640     * @param callback
641     *         Callback interface to listen events. Can be null.
642     * @param forceApplyOnReleaseBuild
643     *         if you want to keep DeployGate alive on
644     *         the release build, set this true.
645     * @param customLogConfiguration
646     *         set a configuration for custom logging
647     *
648     * @since 4.4.0
649     */
650    public static void install(
651            Application app,
652            String author,
653            DeployGateCallback callback,
654            boolean forceApplyOnReleaseBuild,
655            CustomLogConfiguration customLogConfiguration
656    ) {
657        if (sInstance != null) {
658            Log.w(TAG, "DeployGate.install was already called. Ignoring.");
659            return;
660        }
661
662        HostApp hostApp = new HostApp(app.getApplicationContext());
663
664        if (!forceApplyOnReleaseBuild && !hostApp.debuggable) {
665            return;
666        }
667
668        Thread.setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler(new DeployGateUncaughtExceptionHandler(Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()));
669        sInstance = new DeployGate(app.getApplicationContext(), author, callback, customLogConfiguration, hostApp);
670    }
671
672    /**
673     * Request refreshing cached session values (e.g., isAuthorized, etc.) to
674     * the DeployGate service. Nothing happens if this called before
675     * {@link #install(Application)} or when refreshing is already in progress.
676     * Note that after calling this, {@link #isInitialized()} will changed to
677     * false immediately and any call to <code>is*()</code> will be blocked until
678     * refreshing get finished.
679     *
680     * @since r1
681     */
682    public static void refresh() {
683        if (sInstance != null) {
684            sInstance.refreshInternal();
685        }
686    }
687
688    private void refreshInternal() {
689        if (mInitializedLatch.getCount() == 0) {
690            mInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
691            if (mRemoteService == null) {
692                initService(false);
693            } else {
694                requestServiceInit(false);
695            }
696        }
697    }
698
699    /**
700     * Register a DeployGate event callback listener. Don't forget to call
701     * {@link #unregisterCallback(DeployGateCallback)} when the callback is no
702     * longer needed (e.g., on destroying an activity.) If the listener has
703     * already in the callback list, just ignored.
704     *
705     * @param listener
706     *         callback listener
707     * @param refreshImmediately
708     *         if you want to receive current states, set this
709     *         true.
710     *
711     * @since r1
712     */
713    public static void registerCallback(
714            DeployGateCallback listener,
715            boolean refreshImmediately
716    ) {
717        if (sInstance == null) {
718            return;
719        }
720        if (listener == null) {
721            return;
722        }
723
724        sInstance.registerCallbackInternal(listener, refreshImmediately);
725    }
726
727    private void registerCallbackInternal(
728            DeployGateCallback listener,
729            boolean callbackImmediately
730    ) {
731        mCallbacks.add(listener);
732        if (callbackImmediately) {
733            refresh();
734        }
735    }
736
737    /**
738     * Unregister a callback listener. If the listener was not registered, just
739     * ignored.
740     *
741     * @param listener
742     *         callback listener to be removed
743     *
744     * @since r1
745     */
746    public static void unregisterCallback(DeployGateCallback listener) {
747        if (sInstance == null) {
748            return;
749        }
750        if (listener == null) {
751            return;
752        }
753
754        sInstance.mCallbacks.remove(listener);
755    }
756
757    /**
758     * Get whether SDK is completed its intialization process and ready after
759     * {@link #install(Application)}. This call will never blocked.
760     *
761     * @return true if SDK is ready. false otherwise. If no install() called
762     * ever, this always returns false.
763     *
764     * @since r1
765     */
766    public static boolean isInitialized() {
767        if (sInstance != null) {
768            return sInstance.mInitializedLatch.getCount() == 0;
769        }
770        return false;
771    }
772
773    /**
774     * Get whether DeployGate client service is available on this device.
775     * <p>
776     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
777     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
778     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
779     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
780     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
781     * </p>
782     *
783     * @return true if valid DeployGate client is available. false otherwise. If
784     * no install() called ever, this always returns false.
785     *
786     * @since r1
787     */
788    public static boolean isDeployGateAvaliable() {
789        if (sInstance != null) {
790            waitForInitialized();
791            return sInstance.mIsDeployGateAvailable;
792        }
793        return false;
794    }
795
796    /**
797     * Get whether this application and its package is known and managed under
798     * the DeployGate.
799     * <p>
800     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
801     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
802     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
803     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
804     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
805     * </p>
806     *
807     * @return true if DeployGate knows and manages this package. false
808     * otherwise. If no install() called ever, this always returns
809     * false.
810     *
811     * @since r1
812     */
813    public static boolean isManaged() {
814        if (sInstance != null) {
815            waitForInitialized();
816            return sInstance.mAppIsManaged;
817        }
818        return false;
819    }

821    /**
822     * Get whether current DeployGate user has this application in his/her
823     * available list. You may want to check this value on initialization
824     * process of the main activity if you want to limit user of this
825     * application to only who you explicitly allowed.
826     * <p>
827     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
828     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
829     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
830     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
831     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
832     * </p>
833     *
834     * @return true if current DeployGate user has available list which contains
835     * this application. false otherwise. If no install() called ever,
836     * this always returns false.
837     *
838     * @since r1
839     */
840    public static boolean isAuthorized() {
841        if (sInstance != null) {
842            waitForInitialized();
843            return sInstance.mAppIsAuthorized;
844        }
845        return false;
846    }

867        }
868        return null;

871    /**
872     * Get current app's author (e.g., User or Organzation) name on DeployGate. You
873     * may use this value to check the app was distributed by yourself or
874     * someone else.
875     * <p>
876     * <b>Tip:</b> If you want to prevent distributing your app by someone else
877     * on the DeployGate, consider using {@link #install(Application, String)}.
878     * </p>
879     * <p>
880     * Note this function will block until SDK get ready after
881     * {@link #install(Application)} called. So if you want to call this
882     * function from the main thread, you should confirm that
883     * {@link #isInitialized()} is true before calling this. (Or consider using
884     * {@link DeployGateCallback#onInitialized(boolean)} callback.)
885     * </p>
886     *
887     * @return Owner User or Organization of current app. May be null.
888     *
889     * @since r2
890     */
891    public static String getAuthorUsername() {
892        if (sInstance != null) {
893            waitForInitialized();
894            return sInstance.mAuthor;
895        }
896        return null;
897    }

899    /**
900     * Record ERROR level event on DeployGate. Log message will immediately send
901     * to the server so you may see it on your dashboard. Nothing happen when
902     * DeployGate is not available, i.e. {@link #isAuthorized()} is not true.
903     *
904     * @param message
905     *         Message body to be send. May be truncated if it's too
906     *         long.
907     *
908     * @since r1
909     */
910    public static void logError(String message) {
911        if (sInstance != null) {
912            sInstance.sendLog("error", message);
913        }
914    }

985    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
986    private/* public */ static boolean isStopRequested() {
987        if (sInstance != null) {
988            waitForInitialized();
989            return sInstance.mAppIsStopRequested;
990        }
991        return false;
992    }
993
994    private static void waitForInitialized() {
995        try {
996            sInstance.mInitializedLatch.await();
997        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
998            Log.w(TAG, "Interrupted while waiting initialization");
999        }
1000    }
1001
1002    static DeployGate getInstance() {
1003        return sInstance;
1004    }
1005
1006    void sendCrashReport(/* non-null */ Throwable ex) {
1007        if (mRemoteService == null) {
1008            return;
1009        }
1010
1011        Bundle extras = new Bundle();
1012        try {
1013            if (mDeployGateClient.isSupported(Compatibility.SERIALIZED_EXCEPTION)) {
1014                Throwable rootCause = getRootCause(ex);
1015                String msg = rootCause.getMessage();
1016                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_ROOT_CAUSE_CLASSNAME, rootCause.getClass().getName());
1017                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_ROOT_CAUSE_MESSAGE, msg != null ? msg : "");
1018                extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION_STACKTRACES, Log.getStackTraceString(ex));
1019            } else {
1020                extras.putSerializable(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_EXCEPTION, ex);
1021            }
1022
1023            mRemoteService.sendEvent(mHostApp.packageName, DeployGateEvent.ACTION_SEND_CRASH_REPORT, extras);
1024        } catch (RemoteException e) {
1025            Log.w(TAG, "failed to send crash report: " + e.getMessage());
1026        }
1027    }
1028
1029    /* non-null */
1030    private static Throwable getRootCause(/* non-null */ Throwable ex) {
1031        Throwable cause = ex;
1032        LinkedList<Throwable> throwables = new LinkedList<>();
1033
1034        while (cause != null && !throwables.contains(cause)) {
1035            throwables.add(cause);
1036            cause = cause.getCause();
1037        }
1038
1039        return throwables.getLast();
1040    }
1041
1042    void sendLog(
1043            String type,
1044            String body
1045    ) {
1046        mCustomLogInstructionSerializer.requestSendingLog(new CustomLog(type, body));
1047    }
1048
1049    static boolean isFeatureSupported(Compatibility compatibility) {
1050        if (sInstance == null) {
1051            return false;
1052        }
1053
1054        return sInstance.mDeployGateClient.isSupported(compatibility);
1055    }

1057    /**
1058     * Capture current LogCat and send it. This call will work asynchronously.
1059     * Capturing LogCat requires <code>android.permission.READ_LOGS</code> is
1060     * declared on your app AndroidManifest.xml, or your app is running on
1061     * Android 4.1 or higher. If LogCat is not available, this function simply
1062     * does nothing.
1063     *
1064     * @since r3
1065     */
1066    public static void requestLogCat() {
1067        if (sInstance != null) {
1068            sInstance.requestOneshotLogcat();
1069        }
1070    }

1073    /**
1074     * Returns the revision of the app on DeployGate.
1075     * The revision number is automatically incremented integer value every time you upload a build to DeployGate,
1076     * so you can identify the build explicitly.
1077     * <p>
1078     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns 0.
1079     *
1080     * @return revision number of the app, or 0 if DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1081     *
1082     * @since r4
1083     */
1084    public static int getCurrentRevision() {
1085        if (sInstance != null) {
1086            return sInstance.mCurrentRevision;
1087        }
1088        return 0;
1089    }
1090
1091    /**
1092     * Returns the URL of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1093     * <p>
1094     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1095     *
1096     * @return URL of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1097     *
1098     * @since r4
1099     */
1100    public static String getDistributionUrl() {
1101        if (sInstance == null) {
1102            return null;
1103        }
1104
1105        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionId)) {
1106            return null;
1107        }
1108
1109        return "https://deploygate.com/distributions/" + sInstance.mDistributionId;
1110    }
1111
1112    /**
1113     * Returns the ID (40 digits hex string appears in URL) of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1114     * <p>
1115     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1116     *
1117     * @return ID of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1118     *
1119     * @since r4
1120     */
1121    public static String getDistributionId() {
1122        if (sInstance == null) {
1123            return null;
1124        }
1125
1126        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionId)) {
1127            return null;
1128        }
1129
1130        return sInstance.mDistributionId;
1131    }
1132
1133    /**
1134     * Returns the title of the distribution if the app was installed through Distribution Page.
1135     * <p>
1136     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1137     *
1138     * @return Title of the distribution page, null if the app was not installed through Distribution Page or DeployGate is older than v1.7.0 (39)
1139     *
1140     * @since r4
1141     */
1142    public static String getDistributionTitle() {
1143        if (sInstance == null) {
1144            return null;
1145        }
1146
1147        if (TextUtils.isEmpty(sInstance.mDistributionTitle)) {
1148            return null;
1149        }
1150
1151        return sInstance.mDistributionTitle;
1152    }

1156     *

1158     */
1159    @Deprecated

1162            return 0;
1163        }
1164
1165        return (int) sInstance.mDeployGateClient.versionCode;

1183    /**
1184     * Check whether there's update of the app.
1185     * You can get detailed information via {@link #getUpdateRevision()}, {@link #getUpdateVersionCode()}, {@link #getUpdateVersionName()}, and {@link #getUpdateMessage()}.
1186     *
1187     * @return true if there's an update, false otherwise.
1188     *
1189     * @since r4.2
1190     */
1191    public static boolean hasUpdate() {
1192        if (sInstance == null) {
1193            return false;
1194        }
1195
1196        return sInstance.mAppUpdateAvailable;
1197    }

1212    }

1244    /**
1245     * Returns the message attached to the build.
1246     * If the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is not null,}
1247     * this method returns Release Note that was entered when you published a new version on the page.
1248     * Otherwise this method returns the message that was entered when you upload a new build to DeployGate.
1249     * <p>
1250     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function always returns null.
1251     *
1252     * @return The message attached to the build
1253     *
1254     * @since r4
1255     */
1256    public static String getUpdateMessage() {
1257        if (sInstance == null || !isFeatureSupported(Compatibility.UPDATE_MESSAGE_OF_BUILD)) {
1258            return null;
1259        }
1260
1261        return sInstance.mAppUpdateMessage;
1262    }
1263
1264    /**
1265     * Start the installation of the latest version of the app if available. No effects if there's no update.
1266     * <p>
1267     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1268     *
1269     * @since r4
1270     */
1271    public static void installUpdate() {
1272        if (sInstance == null) {
1273            return;
1274        }
1275
1276        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_INSTALL_UPDATE, null, false);
1277    }
1278
1279    /**
1280     * Open comments screen for the distribution of the app installed.
1281     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1282     * <p>
1283     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1284     *
1285     * @since r4
1286     */
1287    public static void openComments() {
1288        if (sInstance == null || sInstance.mDistributionId == null) {
1289            return;
1290        }
1291
1292        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_OPEN_COMMENTS, null, false);
1293    }
1294
1295    /**
1296     * Open comment composer screen for the distribution of the app installed.
1297     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1298     * <p>
1299     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1300     *
1301     * @since r4
1302     */
1303    public static void composeComment() {
1304        composeComment(null);
1305    }
1306
1307    /**
1308     * Open comment composer screen for the distribution of the app installed with pre filled string.
1309     * No effect if the app was installed via Distribution Page (i.e. {@link #getDistributionUrl() is null.}
1310     * <p>
1311     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function produces no effect.
1312     *
1313     * @param defaultComment
1314     *         Default comment set to the editor
1315     *
1316     * @since r4
1317     */
1318    public static void composeComment(String defaultComment) {
1319        if (sInstance == null || sInstance.mDistributionId == null) {
1320            return;
1321        }
1322
1323        Bundle extras = new Bundle();
1324        extras.putString(DeployGateEvent.EXTRA_COMMENT, defaultComment);
1325        sInstance.invokeAction(DeployGateEvent.ACTION_COMPOSE_COMMENT, extras, false);
1326    }
1327
1328    /**
1329     * Get current user's name on Distribution Page. Default name is randomly generated string (like "[abcd1234]").
1330     * <p>
1331     * Requires DeployGate v1.7.0 or higher installed, otherwise this function returns null.
1332     *
1333     * @return User's display name on DeployGate. May be null.
1334     *
1335     * @since r4
1336     */
1337    public static String getDistributionUserName() {
1338        if (sInstance == null) {
1339            return null;
1340        }
1341
1342        return sInstance.mDistributionUserName;
1343    }
